general_advisory: Keep the poultry farm neat & clean, select disease-free chicks for farming & provide adequate poultry feed & clean water to avoid poultry bird diseases. September is the optimum time for nursery raising of tomato. For monitoring sucking pests, fruit fly and borer insect in vegetables, farmers are advised to use pheromone traps. Ensure proper oxygen levels in the pond for pisciculture.

advisory: Brown plant hopper - There is a chance of BPH infestation in paddy. If >10-15 hoppers/hill noticed, spray Pymetrozine, Dinotefuran, Flonicamid, or Triflumezopyrim at the base of the plant.
Bacterial Leaf Blight - There is a chance of Bacterial Leaf Blight disease infestation in paddy. If noticed, spray Copper Hydroxide or Plantomycin with Copper Oxy Chloride.
Stem Rot disease - Seed treatment should be done with Carbendazim or Carboxin + Thiram. To manage Stem Rot disease, spray Validamycin or Captan + Hexaconazole.
Leaf webber - Spray Profenophos or Chlorpyriphos + Cypermethrin for leaf webber control.
Sucking Pests - Neem-based pesticide may be sprayed for sucking pests.
Wilt - Apply Metiram at the root zone of the plant for control.
Epilachna Beetle - To manage Epilachna Beetle, spray neem-based pesticide or Chlorpyriphos.
Mealy bug - To manage mealy bug, spray neem-based pesticide or insecticidal soap.
Maintain ideal dissolved oxygen levels using aerators or water circulation methods.
